private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H
I can only move one disk at a time and must follow Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves that respect my disk permissions to achieve the global goal of delivering disk B to the right peg while leaving the middle peg empty and the remaining disks in the specified order on the left peg.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks I J K L M N O
I can only move one disk at a time and must follow Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves that respect my disk permissions to achieve the global goal of delivering disk B to the right peg while leaving the middle peg empty and the remaining disks in the specified order on the left peg.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and produce the final PDDL for FastDownwards
I must integrate agent plans, validate legality, and preserve agent action identities
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans into a consistent cooperative plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the instance.

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle right.
There are 15 disks labeled A smallest through O largest.
Initial configuration: left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O. Middle peg empty. Right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom A C D E F G H I J K L M N O. Middle peg empty. Right peg top to bottom B.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
expected_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may move disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Obey Tower of Hanoi rules and consider the public initial and goal configurations. Only include moves you are permitted to perform.
plan.prompt: You are agent_1 and can move disks A B C D E F G H. Given the public environment information and the global goal, provide the minimal ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you have no moves, return an empty list.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You may move disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Obey Tower of Hanoi rules and consider the public initial and goal configurations. Only include moves you are permitted to perform.
plan.prompt: You are agent_2 and can move disks I J K L M N O. Given the public environment information and the global goal, provide the minimal ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you have no moves, return an empty list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2, validate legality under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must encode three pegs left middle right, 15 disks labeled A through O with size ordering A smallest O largest, and must preserve agent action identities so actions remain associated to agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure compatibility with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the primitive ordered move lists from the agents. Validate their legality and integration into a single cooperative plan. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encode the instance, the initial and goal configurations, the disk size ordering, and actions that keep agent identities distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
